main

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • main.Main

  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Thursday, April 22, 2016
    Class Description:

    Main class where resources are defined and base objects are created.
    Also contains methods for generating various stage elements.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • removeEvents

        public void removeEvents()
        Called during final flag pole sequence.
        Used to disable player from controlling Mario.

      • updateScore

        public static void updateScore(int score)
        Sets the Score of top-left label shown during gameplay.
        Parameters:
        score - Amount by which existing score should be incremented.

      • updateCoins

        public static void updateCoins()
        Sets the Coin count of top-left label shown during gameplay.

      • writeStats

        public void writeStats()
        Writes the final score and enemy kill count and coins to file.

      • addPowerupEffect

        public void addPowerupEffect(double x,
                             double y,
                             int marioState)
        Generate the light effect when Mario takes powerup.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-Location of player
        y - The y-Location of player
        marioState - The Mario's state. Used to decide color of effect.

      • removePowerupEffect

        public void removePowerupEffect()
        Removes the powerup effect. Called by Mario class after completion of effect.

      • switchStagePath

        public java.lang.String switchStagePath()
        To switch stage style after flag has been destroyed. So that player doesn't collide with flag base-block while going into castle. Only Stage Zone 4 data is changed. All other zones remain same.
        Returns:
        The updated Stage Zone 4 collision data after flag has been destroyed.

      • genBrick

        public Brick genBrick(float[] coords,
                      int stageZone)
        To generate new Brick element in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's STAGE_ELEMENTS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of brick. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        Returns:
        The generated Brick element with specific position supplied.

      • genTile

        public CoinTile genTile(float[] coords,
                        int stageZone)
        To generate new Coin Tile element in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's STAGE_ELEMENTS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of tile. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        Returns:
        The generated Tile element with specific position supplied.

      • genPowerTile

        public PowerTile genPowerTile(float[] coords,
                              int stageZone)
        To generate new Power Tile element in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's STAGE_ELEMENTS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of Power Tile. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        Returns:
        The generated Tile element with specific position supplied.

      • genStarBrick

        public StarBrick genStarBrick(float[] coords,
                              int stageZone)
        To generate new Star Brick (which generates invincibility star) element in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's STAGE_ELEMENTS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of Star Brick. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        Returns:
        The generated Star Brick element with specific position supplied.

      • genSecretBlock

        public SecretBlock genSecretBlock(float[] coords,
                                  int stageZone)
        To generate new Secret Block (which generates yolo image by default) element in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's STAGE_ELEMENTS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of Secret Block. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        Returns:
        The generated Secret Block element with specific position supplied.

      • genFireball

        public Fireball genFireball(float xPos,
                            float yPos,
                            int direction)
        To generate new fireball power from player when requested by user. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's POWERS list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        xPos - the x-Position of player. Used to set the x-starting point of fireball.
        yPos - the y-Position of player. Used to set the y-starting point of fireball.
        direction - the direction in which player is facing (1 or right and -1 for left.
        Using getScale method of ImageView class on spriteFrame of player. Used to set the direction of fireball.
        Returns:
        The generated Fireball element with specific position supplied.

      • genFireballBig

        public FireballBig genFireballBig(float xPos,
                                  float yPos)
        To generate new bigger fireball power from player when requested by user. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's POWERS list and to the stageContainer. For now it is only used when flag pole sequence is being run.
        Parameters:
        xPos - the x-Position of player. Used to set the x-starting point of fireball.
        yPos - the y-Position of player. Used to set the y-starting point of fireball.
        Returns:
        The generated FireballBig element with specific position supplied.

      • genGoomba

        public Goomba genGoomba(float[] coords,
                        int stageZone,
                        boolean checkBlocks)
        To generate new Goomba enemy in stage. The generated element must be added into SpriteHandler class's ENEMIES list and to the stageContainer.
        Parameters:
        coords - Coordinates of brick. Use RelCoordinates class's getRelCoordsArr method to generate this.
        stageZone - Define the stage zone in which element is present from 0-4. Each stage zone is separated by a pit.
        checkBlocks - If the Goomba's collision logic code should include checking collisions with StageBlock elements. Includes brick, tiles and other blocks.
        Returns:
        The generated Goomba enemy with specific position supplied.

      • getRoot

        public javafx.scene.Group getRoot()
        Returns:
        The main Parent which contains all elements of game including menus, stage, elements and characters.

      • getMenuContainer

        public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane getMenuContainer()
        Returns:
        The container containing Menu elements.

      • getStageFloorBase

        public StageFloorBase getStageFloorBase()
        Returns:
        The Floor of stage.

      • getStageContainer

        public javafx.scene.Group getStageContainer()
        Returns:
        The parent containing stage elements: Tiles, Bricks, Enemies, Stage Floor etc.

      • getGameLoop

        public GameLoop getGameLoop()
        Returns:
        The main loop which controls the game. The rate of loop is 60fps by default.

      • getPlayer

        public Mario getPlayer()
        Returns:
        The main Player object (Mario).

      • getAura

        public Aura getAura()
        Returns:
        The Aura object (aura is added to player after second stage powerup is taken).

      • getFlagDestroyEffects

        public javafx.scene.image.Image[] getFlagDestroyEffects()
        Returns:
        The Image Array containing Flag Burning Sprites.

      • getFlagDestroyEffectView

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getFlagDestroyEffectView()
        Returns:
        The ImageView used as container for Flag Destruction Effect

      • getElevateEffectView

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getElevateEffectView()
        Returns:
        The blue base effect added to player (Mario) during flag destruction sequence by default.

      • getJumpEffect

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getJumpEffect()
        Returns:
        The brown concentric ellipse effect added when player jumps.

      • getJumpTrail

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getJumpTrail()
        Returns:
        The white trail-lines effect added when player jumps.

      • getPowerEffect

        public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getPowerEffect(int marioState)
        The light effect when Mario takes powerup
        Parameters:
        marioState - The Mario's state of growth (increases with powerups) to determine color of effect.
        Returns:
        THe light effect.

        Returns:

      • stopJump

        public void stopJump()
        To stop the player's jump in mid air. Used when player collides with something in mid air.

      • isSprinting

        public boolean isSprinting()
        Returns:
        If SPRINT button is pressed by user.

      • isShootingFireball

        public boolean isShootingFireball()
        Allows to shoot fireballs after pressing and releasing shoot fireball button.
        Returns:
        If FIREBALL button is pressed by user and player is in valid condition to shoot fireball.

      • setRight

        public void setRight()
        This is called during finishing of flag pole sequence To make player go into castle

      • setGameOverUI

        public void setGameOverUI(boolean playerDied)
        Sets game-end UI based on whether player has completed stage or died before completing. Called by GameLoop class.
        Parameters:
        playerDied - If player died before completing stage,
